verb.description: Speak (words or speech) indistinctly so that the sounds run into one another.
examples: he was slurring his words like a drunk

verb.description: Perform (a group of two or more notes) legato.
examples: I can play it if I don't slur the notes

verb.description: Make damaging or insulting insinuations or allegations about.
examples: I was not trying to slur the integrity of the committee

noun.description: An insinuation or allegation about someone that is likely to insult them or damage their reputation.
examples: the comments were a slur on the staff

noun.description: An act of speaking indistinctly so that sounds or words run into one another or a tendency to speak in such a way.
examples: there was a mean slur in his voice

noun.description: A curved line used to show that a group of two or more notes is to be sung to one syllable or played or sung legato.

origin: Middle English: originally as noun in sense thin, fluid mud, later as verb meaning smear, smirch, disparage (a person), gloss over (a fault).
